title: Middle East Crisis: Hamas Names an Architect of Oct. 7 Attacks as New Political Leader
content: Hamas announced that Yahya Sinwar would take over as the group’s political leader after the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh in Iran.
summary: Hamas announced that Yahya Sinwar would take over as the group’s political leader after the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh in Iran.

title: Bangladesh Prime Minister’s Sheikh Hasina’s Chaotic Final Hours
content: As masses of people converged, angry at the killing of protesters, Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina insisted that she could hold on, which military leaders said would mean spilling far more blood.
summary: As masses of people converged, angry at the killing of protesters, Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina insisted that she could hold on, which military leaders said would mean spilling far more blood.

title: Venezuela’s Strongman Was Confident of Victory. Then Came the Shock.
content: Venezuela’s government believed its control of all levers of power would give the country’s authoritarian president an Election Day victory. A rebellion by its supporters undid the plan.

content: The new government was being formed a day after Bangladesh’s longtime leader, facing fierce protests, fled the country.

title: Can Freed Russian Dissidents Help Energize Opposition Movement?

title: Iran Executes Protester Reza Rasaei After Trial Condemned by Rights Groups

summary: Weeks after Iran elected a reformist leader, the authorities executed Reza Rasaei, who was arrested during protests that swept the country in 2022.

title: Behind the Biggest Prisoner Swap Since the Cold War
content: The recent prisoner exchange between Russia and the U.S. — the biggest and most complex since the Cold War — was a diplomatic chess game that required patience and creativity. Mark Mazzetti, an investigative reporter for The New York Times, explains. An earlier version of a map used in this video referred incorrectly to the status of Crimea by including it as part of Russia. Russia seized the peninsula in 2014, and most countries do not recognize Crimea as Russian territory.
